title: Relative velocity - boat crossing a river

content.question: A boat is traveling across a river with a current, as shown in the figure. The boat has a speed <math alttext="v sub B equals 4 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> relative to the water, and the current has a speed <math alttext="v sub C equals 3 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>C</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> relative to the shore. What is the velocity of the boat relative to the shore?
